meaning: To reduce in intensity or amount
examples: The storm began to abate after hours of heavy rain.
His anger abated once he heard the full explanation.

meaning: Kind and generous
examples: The benevolent old man donated his entire fortune to charity.
Her benevolent smile reassured the nervous child.

meaning: Honest and straightforward
examples: She gave a candid opinion about the new policy.
His candid admission surprised everyone in the room.

meaning: Skillful and quick
examples: The chef’s deft hands sliced the vegetables in seconds.
She handled the tricky situation with deft diplomacy.

meaning: Full of energy and enthusiasm
examples: The ebullient crowd cheered as the team scored.
Her ebullient personality lit up the entire party.

meaning: Very attentive to detail
examples: He was fastidious about keeping his desk organized.
Her fastidious nature made her an excellent editor.

meaning: Sociable and outgoing
examples: The gregarious host made everyone feel welcome.
She’s so gregarious that she makes friends wherever she goes.

meaning: Unfortunate or unlucky
examples: The hapless traveler lost his luggage on the first day.
A hapless attempt at repair only worsened the damage.

meaning: Perfect, without any faults
examples: Her impeccable manners impressed the guests.
The report was written with impeccable accuracy.

meaning: Cheerful and friendly
examples: His jovial laugh echoed through the room.
The jovial atmosphere made the event unforgettable.

meaning: Eager or enthusiastic
examples: She has a keen interest in learning new languages.
He gave a keen observation that solved the puzzle.

meaning: Lacking energy, sluggish
examples: After the meal, he felt lethargic and took a nap.
The hot weather made the dog unusually lethargic.

meaning: Showing great attention to detail
examples: The artist was meticulous in every brushstroke.
His meticulous planning ensured the project’s success.

meaning: A sentimental longing for the past
examples: The old song filled her with nostalgia for her youth.
Visiting his hometown stirred up waves of nostalgia.

meaning: No longer in use or relevant
examples: The old software became obsolete with the update.
Typewriters are now considered obsolete technology.

meaning: Deep in thought, often with a hint of sadness
examples: She gazed out the window with a pensive expression.
His pensive mood was evident after the news.

meaning: Charmingly old-fashioned
examples: The quaint village attracted many tourists.
She lived in a quaint little cottage by the sea.

meaning: Able to recover quickly from difficulties
examples: The resilient team bounced back after the loss.
Children are often more resilient than adults realize.

meaning: Enduring pain or hardship without complaint
examples: He remained stoic despite the harsh criticism.
Her stoic silence spoke volumes about her strength.

meaning: Determined and persistent
examples: The tenacious athlete trained despite the injury.
Her tenacious spirit helped her overcome obstacles.

meaning: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty
examples: The room was decorated with an aesthetic appeal.
He admired the aesthetic qualities of the painting.

meaning: Open to more than one interpretation; unclear
examples: His ambiguous response left us confused.
The instructions were too ambiguous to follow.

meaning: Very enthusiastic or passionate
examples: She was an ardent supporter of the cause.
His ardent love for music was evident in his collection.

meaning: Severe or strict in manner; simple and unadorned
examples: The austere room had only a bed and a chair.
His austere demeanor intimidated the students.

meaning: Hostile and aggressive
examples: The belligerent customer yelled at the staff.
His belligerent attitude started the argument.

meaning: Concise and exact use of words
examples: The brevity of her speech made it impactful.
He appreciated the brevity of the instructions.

meaning: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds
examples: The cacophony of the city kept her awake.
A cacophony of horns greeted the morning rush.

meaning: Impulsive and unpredictable
examples: Her capricious decisions confused her friends.
The weather was capricious, changing every hour.

meaning: Intellectual rather than emotional
examples: He preferred cerebral discussions over small talk.
The book appealed to a cerebral audience.

meaning: Kept secret or done secretively
examples: They held a clandestine meeting at midnight.
The clandestine operation went unnoticed.

meaning: Logical and consistent
examples: Her argument was coherent and convincing.
The essay was well-written and coherent.

meaning: Smug or uncritically satisfied with oneself
examples: He became complacent after his early success.
Her complacent attitude annoyed her teammates.

meaning: A confusing and difficult problem or question
examples: The puzzle presented a conundrum to the group.
Finding a solution was a real conundrum.

meaning: Able to be believed; convincing
examples: Her story seemed credible to the jury.
He provided credible evidence for his claim.

meaning: Hasty and not thorough or detailed
examples: He gave the report a cursory glance.
The cursory inspection missed the flaws.

meaning: Fearless and determined
examples: The dauntless explorer faced the storm.
Her dauntless spirit inspired others.

meaning: Harmful or damaging
examples: Smoking has deleterious effects on health.
The policy had a deleterious impact on morale.

meaning: Distinctly different in kind
examples: They came from disparate backgrounds.
The two ideas were completely disparate.

meaning: Ready to accept control or instruction; submissive
examples: The docile puppy followed every command.
He was surprisingly docile during the meeting.

meaning: The ability to produce a desired result
examples: The vaccine’s efficacy was proven in trials.
She doubted the efficacy of the new plan.

meaning: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve
examples: The elusive thief evaded capture for years.
Success remained elusive despite her efforts.

meaning: Famous and respected within a particular sphere
examples: He was an eminent scientist in his field.
The eminent author gave a lecture.

meaning: A person or thing that is mysterious or difficult to understand
examples: She was an enigma to her classmates.
The case remained an enigma to the police.

meaning: Lasting for a very short time
examples: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral.
Their joy was ephemeral, fading quickly.

meaning: Unpredictable or inconsistent
examples: His erratic behavior worried his friends.
The machine’s erratic performance caused delays.

meaning: Serving as an outstanding model or example
examples: Her exemplary work earned her a promotion.
He showed exemplary courage in the crisis.

meaning: Full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness
examples: The exuberant child ran around the park.
Her exuberant greeting lifted everyone’s spirits.

meaning: To understand after much thought
examples: She couldn’t fathom why he left so suddenly.
He tried to fathom the complex problem.

meaning: Changing frequently, especially in loyalties or affections
examples: The fickle crowd switched sides quickly.
Her fickle tastes made planning difficult.

meaning: Tending to attract attention with confidence and style
examples: He wore a flamboyant suit to the party.
Her flamboyant personality stood out.

meaning: Inspiring fear or respect through being powerful
examples: The team faced a formidable opponent.
Her formidable intellect impressed everyone.

meaning: Sparing or economical with money or food
examples: He lived a frugal life to save money.
Her frugal habits surprised her wealthy friends.

meaning: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
examples: The garrulous neighbor never stopped chatting.
His garrulous speech bored the audience.

meaning: Lacking significance through overuse; clichéd
examples: The hackneyed phrase lost its impact.
His speech was full of hackneyed expressions.
